verse: ता वां वास्तून्युश्मसि गमध्यै यत्र गावो भूरिशृङ्गा अयास:। अत्राह तदुरुगायस्य वृष्ण: परमं पदमव भाति भूरि ॥ (ऋग्वेद १-१५४-६)

terms.This verse is from the Rigveda (1: 154-6) and praises Lord Vishnu as the great giver and the supreme Lord of the universe. It portrays a scene where the devotee is invited to bring their possessions to the abode of Lord Vishnu, where the cows symbolize abundance and prosperity. The verse implies that by reaching the divine abode of Lord Vishnu, one can achieve the highest spiritual state and attain immense blessings and abundance.

meaning: Translation:O shining one, bring your possessions here, where the cows with abundant horns, without fatigue, reside. Here, you will attain the supreme position of the great giver (God), the Lord of the worlds (Vishnu)
